title: Sam's Sourdough Waffles Recipe
description: This sourdough waffle recipe is easy to make and produces delicious waffles that are golden and crispy on the outside and super fluffy inside!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Waffle Recipes Sam's Sourdough Waffles 4.9 (183) 163 Reviews 41 Photos This sourdough waffle recipe is simple to remember and asks for minimal amounts of perishables, making it great for campouts or fundraising breakfasts. The waffles are crispy outside and super soft within. I got this recipe from a friend who used it to make fantastic sourdough pancakes: Thanks, Mr. Hannula!! Submitted by Sam Nemati Updated on November 4, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 41 41 41 41 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 4 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 40 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 to 10 waffles Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour 1 ½ cups water 1 cup sourdough starter ½ cup vegetable oil 2 eggs 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons salt 1 tablespoon water 1 teaspoon baking soda Directions Mix flour, 1 1/2 cups water, and sourdough starter together in a large bowl to make batter; cover loosely with plastic wrap and let sit in a warm place until filled with large holes and bubbles, 4 hours to overnight. Stir oil, eggs, sugar, and salt into the batter; mix well to combine. Whisk 1 tablespoon water and baking soda together in a small bowl until dissolved. Fold into the batter with a rubber spatula. Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions. Pour about 1/3 cup batter onto preheated iron and bake until crisp and golden, according to manufacturer's instructions, about 3 minutes. Continue making waffles until all remaining batter is used. Add Your Photo Photos of Sam's Sourdough Waffles 01 of 41 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 41 Photo by  TLCbyARM 03/29/2023 I doubled the recipe except for the starter and it turned out the SAME!! I was super excited about that because it was a school day and 8-10 waffles isn’t enough for a family of six, half being teens! 03 of 41 Photo by  LankyJam1105 03/04/2023 These were delicious. A great recipe to use for my leftover starter. 04 of 41 Photo by  SavvyWok3589 01/10/2023 These waffles were spot on! Even drenched in berries, their juices, and maple syrup they held together beautifully and didn't turn to mush.There was one slight change I made and that was using oat milk for the water, but I only added 1 cup of the milk and half a cup of water. Delish! Keeping this recipe! 05 of 41 Photo by  Jul Lzz 08/30/2022 These are amazing !I add blueberries, cheddar &jalapeños, plain. All are awesome.Make a great sandwich too :) 06 of 41 Photo by  Veggies 8 07/02/2021 Pretty good! Having to plan ahead and let the starter sit over night. Light and fluffy! Added a mashed banana for a little flavor! 07 of 41 Photo by  Wendy 02/23/2021 Great flavor, soft and chewy on the outside, light crispy crust. Family approved! 08 of 41 Photo by  Byron Hof 01/30/2021 The family loves these waffles, I did add 1 teaspoon of vanilla, and wow they taste and smell like vanilla birthday cake. Fresh berries and some whipped cream also with a splash of vanilla. It is very hard not eat more than one. 09 of 41 Photo by  Dianehuntster 01/06/2021 The waffles baked beautifully! Crispy golden brown on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside. Having never tasted sourdough waffles, at first bite, the taste is off a bit. Could just be my sourdough starter. I still gobbled mine up, as did the kiddos. This recipe made 12 square waffles in total. 10 of 41 Photo by  Amy 12/30/2020 I made them exactly as the recipe stated and they came out perfectly! So delicious, crispy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside. I made them yesterday and my daughter is already asking me to make them again. Thank you! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Sourdough Waffles 3 Ratings Sourdough Discard Waffles 10 Ratings Sweet Potato Waffles 9 Ratings Puff Pastry Waffles 32 Ratings Best Vegan Chocolate Oatmeal Waffles 2 Ratings Gluten-Free Overnight Yeasted Waffles 5 Ratings Easy French Toast Waffles 97 Ratings Pumpkin Waffles 359 Ratings Waffles 5,385 Ratings Rice Waffles 3 Ratings Pumpkin Waffles with Spiced Maple Syrup 2 Ratings Gingerbread Waffles with Sauteed Pears 3 Ratings Eggnog-Raspberry Belgian Waffles 19 Ratings Zucchini Waffles (Green Waffles) 13 Ratings Banana Waffles 188 Ratings Cinnamon Roll Waffles 49 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Sam Nemati
instructions: Mix flour, 1 1/2 cups water, and sourdough starter together in a large bowl to make batter; cover loosely with plastic wrap and let sit in a warm place until filled with large holes and bubbles, 4 hours to overnight.;Stir oil, eggs, sugar, and salt into the batter; mix well to combine.;Whisk 1 tablespoon water and baking soda together in a small bowl until dissolved. Fold into the batter with a rubber spatula.;Preheat a waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions.;Pour about 1/3 cup batter onto preheated iron and bake until crisp and golden, according to manufacturer's instructions, about 3 minutes. Continue making waffles until all remaining batter is used.
